posts.name:
Jeff Winter
Jeff Winter
posts.content:
People don’t fear change. They fear being changed without a clear purpose.

Manufacturing has always been a testament to human ingenuity—from the assembly lines of the Industrial Revolution to the hyper-automated factories of today. But as we push forward in the era of Industry 4.0, the landscape of manufacturing jobs is undergoing a seismic shift. Manufacturing is evolving. We’re no longer just building things; we’re building smarter ways to work. The future isn’t about humans versus machines—it’s about how they work together.

According to the 𝟐𝟎𝟐𝟓 𝐅𝐮𝐭𝐮𝐫𝐞 𝐨𝐟 𝐉𝐨𝐛𝐬 𝐑𝐞𝐩𝐨𝐫𝐭, manufacturing is experiencing a different kind of transformation compared to other industries. It’s not just automation replacing jobs; it’s augmentation enhancing them. By 2030, 𝟒𝟑% 𝐨𝐟 𝐭𝐚𝐬𝐤 𝐫𝐞𝐝𝐮𝐜𝐭𝐢𝐨𝐧𝐬 𝐰𝐢𝐥𝐥 𝐛𝐞 𝐝𝐮𝐞 𝐭𝐨 𝐚𝐮𝐭𝐨𝐦𝐚𝐭𝐢𝐨𝐧, but 𝟑𝟏% 𝐰𝐢𝐥𝐥 𝐜𝐨𝐦𝐞 𝐟𝐫𝐨𝐦 𝐚𝐮𝐠𝐦𝐞𝐧𝐭𝐚𝐭𝐢𝐨𝐧, where humans collaborate with technology. Additionally, the report highlights that the top three technological drivers of transformation in manufacturing are 𝐀𝐈 𝐚𝐧𝐝 𝐢𝐧𝐟𝐨𝐫𝐦𝐚𝐭𝐢𝐨𝐧 𝐩𝐫𝐨𝐜𝐞𝐬𝐬𝐢𝐧𝐠 (𝟖𝟔%), 𝐫𝐨𝐛𝐨𝐭𝐢𝐜𝐬 𝐚𝐧𝐝 𝐚𝐮𝐭𝐨𝐧𝐨𝐦𝐨𝐮𝐬 𝐬𝐲𝐬𝐭𝐞𝐦𝐬 (𝟓𝟖%), and 𝐞𝐧𝐞𝐫𝐠𝐲 𝐠𝐞𝐧𝐞𝐫𝐚𝐭𝐢𝐨𝐧 𝐚𝐧𝐝 𝐬𝐭𝐨𝐫𝐚𝐠𝐞 𝐭𝐞𝐜𝐡𝐧𝐨𝐥𝐨𝐠𝐢𝐞𝐬 (𝟒𝟏%).

𝐓𝐡𝐞 𝐌𝐚𝐧𝐮𝐟𝐚𝐜𝐭𝐮𝐫𝐢𝐧𝐠 𝐒𝐡𝐢𝐟𝐭: 𝐁𝐞𝐲𝐨𝐧𝐝 𝐀𝐮𝐭𝐨𝐦𝐚𝐭𝐢𝐨𝐧
By 2030, the share of tasks performed by humans alone will shrink to 33%, down from 47% today, with automation and human-machine collaboration taking center stage. However, the shift isn’t just about automation—it’s about adaptation. The fastest-growing skills in manufacturing include:
• 𝐀𝐈 𝐚𝐧𝐝 𝐁𝐢𝐠 𝐃𝐚𝐭𝐚:  Expected to grow by 25% in electronics and 22% in consumer goods.
• 𝐒𝐮𝐬𝐭𝐚𝐢𝐧𝐚𝐛𝐢𝐥𝐢𝐭𝐲 𝐄𝐱𝐩𝐞𝐫𝐭𝐢𝐬𝐞: Increasing in demand by 34% in advanced manufacturing as companies aim for greener production.
• 𝐑𝐞𝐬𝐢𝐥𝐢𝐞𝐧𝐜𝐞 𝐚𝐧𝐝 𝐅𝐥𝐞𝐱𝐢𝐛𝐢𝐥𝐢𝐭𝐲: Recognized by 68% of manufacturers as crucial for navigating supply chain disruptions and evolving demands.

𝐔𝐩𝐬𝐤𝐢𝐥𝐥𝐢𝐧𝐠: 𝐓𝐡𝐞 𝐏𝐚𝐭𝐡 𝐅𝐨𝐫𝐰𝐚𝐫𝐝
By 2030, 𝟓𝟒% 𝐨𝐟 𝐰𝐨𝐫𝐤𝐞𝐫𝐬 𝐚𝐜𝐫𝐨𝐬𝐬 𝐦𝐚𝐧𝐮𝐟𝐚𝐜𝐭𝐮𝐫𝐢𝐧𝐠 𝐬𝐞𝐜𝐭𝐨𝐫𝐬 𝐰𝐢𝐥𝐥 𝐫𝐞𝐪𝐮𝐢𝐫𝐞 𝐬𝐢𝐠𝐧𝐢𝐟𝐢𝐜𝐚𝐧𝐭 𝐫𝐞𝐬𝐤𝐢𝐥𝐥𝐢𝐧𝐠, but 𝟏𝟒% 𝐦𝐚𝐲 𝐥𝐚𝐜𝐤 𝐚𝐜𝐜𝐞𝐬𝐬 𝐭𝐨 𝐧𝐞𝐜𝐞𝐬𝐬𝐚𝐫𝐲 𝐭𝐫𝐚𝐢𝐧𝐢𝐧𝐠.  Companies investing in technical partnerships and digital learning platforms will be best positioned to bridge the skills gap and lead the Industry 4.0 revolution.

𝐑𝐞𝐚𝐝 𝐑𝐞𝐩𝐨𝐫𝐭:

*******************************************
• Visitfor access to all my content and to stay current on Industry 4.0 and other cool tech trends
• Ring the  for notifications!

comments.commentText:
Found a typo Jeff,

"We’re no longer just building things; we’re building smarter ways to work. The future isn’t about humans versus machines—it’s about how they work together."

Should read.

"We’re no longer just building things; we’re building smarter ways to work. The future isn’t about humans versus machines—it’s about how humans USE machines." (As the inanimate, objects they are ... otherwise ....  )

I like how you said that people don't fear change as much as they fear changing without purpose! That line 
#resonates with me way more than the numbers in the WEF report on Future of Jobs. The collective-in-action approach at the WEF makes my little libertarian heart a bit nervous (probably the same "fearing change" point you brought up earlier). Full circle today,!

posts.commentAdded: Exciting times ahead for manufacturing! Embracing collaboration with technology is key to a smarter, more sustainable future. #Industry4.0

posts.name:
Priyank Ahuja
Priyank Ahuja
posts.content:
Living a happy & fulfilling life doesn't depend on your high salary!

With the right mindset and smart strategies, you can make the most of your financial situation and create a fulfilling life.

Here are 5 practical strategies to help you live a great life on a low salary:

[1] Shift to a Smaller City:
- Consider relocating to a smaller city or town where the cost of living is lower.
- Smaller cities often offer more affordable housing options, lower transportation costs, and reduced expenses overall.
- By choosing a location that aligns with your budget, you can stretch your income further and improve your quality of life.

[2] Build a Remote/Virtual Career:
- Embrace the digital age and explore remote work opportunities.
- With advancements in technology, many industries now offer remote job options.
- Look for remote positions that align with your skills and interests, allowing you to work from the comfort of your own home or anywhere in the world.
- Building a remote career can provide flexibility and potentially open up higher-paying opportunities.

[3] Start Investing in Low-Commission Products:
- Despite a low salary, it's important to prioritize saving and investing.
- Look for investment products with low commissions and fees to make the most of your savings.
- Consider options such as low-cost index funds, which provide diversification and long-term growth potential without the high costs associated with actively managed funds.

[4] Become Time Rich if Not Money Rich:
- To maximize your time, invest it wisely by upskilling yourself.
- Improve your skills and knowledge to build a strong portfolio and boost your chances of getting a higher salary or a better job.
- Don't forget, investing in yourself is a valuable long-term strategy that brings more opportunities and financial rewards.

[5] Complete Financial Obligations:
- Take charge of your financial obligations and prioritize paying off any debts or financial burdens.
- Create a budget that allows you to meet your obligations while still saving for the future.
- By tackling your financial responsibilities head-on, you can reduce stress and create a solid foundation for a great life.

Embrace these practical strategies and start creating a life that brings you joy, regardless of your income level.

If you need further guidance on navigating your career or managing your finances, contact me for a consultation and let's work together to create a path towards your desired future.

Followfor more!

If you need assistance in career guidance, interview preparation, and resume review, book a session at www(dot)priyankahuja(dot)com

posts.name:
Shima Ghaheri
Shima Ghaheri
posts.content:
Last week, 102 professionals signed up
for my “Land Your Dream Job” workshop.  

Since then, one question keeps popping up about networking:
“Why would someone respond to me? I’m just a stranger.”

Fair point. And if your outreach sounds like:

"Hi, here’s my portfolio… thoughts?”
“Any jobs at your company?”
“Can I pick your brain?”
(Translation: can I get free advice that took you 10 years to learn?)


...it’s no wonder your inbox is quieter than a library at midnight.

And when the response doesn’t come? Cue the spiral:

→ Was my message bad?
→ Did they hate me? Am I screwed?
→ Maybe I should’ve used more emojis.

The truth?
It’s not about emojis.
It’s about your mindset.

You’ve got to approach outreach with a
“you mindset,” not a “me mindset.”


Want to know how to stand out and actually get responses?
I’m breaking it all down tomorrow in my newsletter.

If you’re tired of hearing crickets after your outreach, this is for you:

comments.commentText: Love this perspective! Shifting from a “me” to a “you” mindset makes all the difference in networking. Excited for your insights in the newsletter!

Shima Ghaheri That's AMAZING! The "You" mindset is everything! 

What would you say is the ONE tip that you would give to help someone stuck in the "me" mindset?

Joseph Cope, M. Ed  ooooh that's an interesting question Joseph. If I had to pick only ONE tip I'd say Practice curiosity. When you’re stuck in a 'me' mindset, flip the script by asking questions about others sth like what they need, how they feel, or what excites them.

posts.commentAdded: Great insights! Shifting to a you mindset can truly transform networking. Excited to see your tips in the newsletter! 🚀 #NetworkingSuccess

posts.name:
Michael Ocean
Michael Ocean
posts.content:
Enablement is not a vending machine - stop treating it like one!


I recently had a conversation with(Director of Learning Design at JLL, formerly led enablement at Outreach). She shared a powerful perspective on why most enablement initiatives fail: treating enablement like a vending machine instead of a strategic partner.


Key insight: You can't just push a button and get instant results. Like any good sales process, enablement needs discovery:

- What's the real problem you're trying to solve?
- Has this training been done before?
- How will we measure success?
- What's the timeline for meaningful impact?


In the full episode, we covered:

- How JLL runs their "Power Hour" program across 600+ global sellers
- Practical frameworks for building sustainable enablement programs
- Strategies for engaging multi-generational remote teams
- Why random training requests kill enablement effectiveness
- Tips for aligning with sales leaders and getting executive buy-in


Something that really stood out: Brooke's team maintains a 70/30 split between programmatic and ad-hoc enablement - proving you can balance structure with flexibility.


Want to hear the full conversation on building effective everboarding programs?

Check out the link in comments

comments.commentText: Great insights! Treating enablement as a strategic partner is crucial for lasting success. Excited to hear more about those frameworks!
Full episode here: https://studio.youtube.com/video/CPPVmmgtHqY/edit

posts.commentAdded: Great insights! Treating enablement as a strategic partner is key to driving lasting impact. Excited to hear more about Brookes approach!

posts.name:
Helen Yu
Helen Yu
posts.content:
What are the top tech trends shaping 2025? 

According to Gartner, here are the Top 10 Technology Trends grouped into three key categories:

 AI Imperatives and Risks
1. Agentic AI: Software making autonomous decisions to automate tasks and boost productivity.
2. AI Governance Platforms: Tools to ensure ethical AI use, improving trust and compliance.
3. Disinformation Security: Cybersecurity solutions to combat disinformation and identity fraud.
 New Frontiers of Computing
4. Post-Quantum Cryptography: Protecting sensitive data from future quantum attacks.
5. Ambient Invisible Intelligence: Low-cost sensors providing real-time visibility in retail and healthcare.
6. Energy-Efficient Computing: Reducing energy use in digital systems and data centers.
7. Hybrid Computing: Combining multiple technologies to solve complex challenges.
 Human-Machine Synergy
8. Spatial Computing: Adding digital content to the physical world for training and shopping.
9. Polyfunctional Robots: Robots performing multiple tasks, especially in healthcare.
10. Neurological Enhancement: Enhancing cognitive abilities through brain-machine interfaces.

These trends represent a shift towards AI-driven autonomy, advanced computing, and human-tech integration, key to digital transformation in 2025 and beyond.

I’ve created a carousel with more details on these trends—check it out for a deeper dive! 

What trend excites you the most? Please share in comments.



Want more insights on
and
?
 Subscribe to the
newsletter hereor our YouTube channel here.
